perturbation.original_text: 13.01 Governing Law. The validity and interpretation of this Agreement and the legal relations of the Parties to it will be governed by the laws of the State of New York without recourse to its conflicts of law rules.
perturbation.changed_text: 20.13 Governing Law. The validity and interpretation of this Agreement and the legal relations of the Parties to it will be governed by the laws of the State of Delaware without recourse to its conflicts of law rules.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the governing law clause to the 'Additional Provisions' section and changing it to Delaware makes it less prominent. Parties might overlook it, leading to disputes about which state's laws apply. Legal contracts require the governing law to be explicitly stated.

perturbation.original_text: 13.02 Arbitration Proceedings. Both Parties will try to amicably resolve any dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement by involving representatives of the Parties with authority to settle such disputes. In the event the Parties are unable to agree upon a resolution within a reasonable period of time, not to exceed sixty (60) days after first notice of the difference unless otherwise agreed in writing, any dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement may be referred to final and binding arbitration before three arbitrators under the Rules of Arbitration of the International Chamber of Commerce. Each Party will appoint one arbitrator within thirty (30) days of notice of such referral and the two (2) so appointed will, within thirty (30) days from the appointment of the last of the two (2) arbitrators, select a third arbitrator who will act as the Chairman. The arbitration will take place in New York City, New York and the proceedings will be conducted in the English language. The arbitrators will decide all questions and settle all disputes strictly in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement, including the relevant indemnities and liability limitations. The arbitrators will have no authority to award exemplary or punitive damages, and the arbitral panel will certify in the decision that no part of the award includes such damages. The Parties waive their rights to seek rulings from any court on issues of law that arise during the arbitration and to challenge the award on the grounds that the arbitrators made errors of law. Awards made pursuant to this Paragraph will be final and binding on the Parties from the date made and judgment upon any award may be entered in any court having jurisdiction. No Party hereto will raise defenses based on sovereign immunity with respect to the arbitration, any judicial proceeding or ancillary thereto or with respect to enforcement of any award, order or judgment rendered in the arbitration or related judicial proceedings.
perturbation.changed_text: 20.14 Arbitration Proceedings. Both Parties will try to amicably resolve any dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement by involving representatives of the Parties with authority to settle such disputes. In the event the Parties are unable to agree upon a resolution within a reasonable period of time, not to exceed sixty (60) days after first notice of the difference unless otherwise agreed in writing, any dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement may be referred to non-binding mediation before a mediator mutually agreed by both parties. Each Party will nominate potential mediators within thirty (30) days of notice of such referral and the two (2) parties will mutually select a mediator. The arbitration will take place in Houston, Texas and the proceedings will be conducted in the Spanish language. The arbitrators will decide all questions and settle all disputes strictly in accordance with the feeling of both parties, including the relevant indemnities and liability limitations. The arbitrators will have authority to award exemplary or punitive damages, and the arbitral panel will certify in the decision that a part of the award includes such damages. The Parties don't waive their rights to seek rulings from any court on issues of law that arise during the arbitration and to challenge the award on the grounds that the arbitrators made errors of law. Awards made pursuant to this Paragraph will not be final and binding on the Parties from the date made and judgment upon any award can't be entered in any court having jurisdiction. Each Party hereto will raise defenses based on sovereign immunity with respect to the arbitration, any judicial proceeding or ancillary thereto or with respect to enforcement of any award, order or judgment rendered in the arbitration or related judicial proceedings.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the arbitration clause to the 'Additional Provisions' section makes it less prominent and potentially overlooked. Changing from binding arbitration to non-binding mediation, changing from the ICC to mediators mutually agreed, location, language, waiving the punitive damages protection, allowing legal intervention, and removing finality changes the meaning, contradicting the original intent of a clear dispute resolution process.

perturbation.original_text: 17.03 Export Control and Trade Sanctions. Neither Party will furnish, deliver, or release the technology, services, software, or commodities made available to it hereunder to any individual, entity, or destination, or for any use, except in full accordance with all applicable laws, regulations, and requirements of the United States with regard to export control and trade sanctions. Both Parties agree and understand that each will be responsible for ongoing compliance with all such applicable laws, regulations, and requirements. It will be a material breach if a Receiving Party takes any action or uses any of a Disclosing Party's information in any manner which would violate United States laws, regulations, or requirements restricting the export, re-export, transfer or release to certain entities or destinations, including to persons within the Receiving Party or its Affiliates, or to unrelated Third Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 20.15 Export Control and Trade Sanctions. Neither Party will furnish, deliver, or release the technology, services, software, or commodities made available to it hereunder to any individual, entity, or destination, or for any use, except in accordance with what they each deem acceptable, without consulting any laws, regulations, and requirements of the United States with regard to export control and trade sanctions. Both Parties agree and understand that each will be not responsible for ongoing compliance with all such applicable laws, regulations, and requirements. It will not be a material breach if a Receiving Party takes any action or uses any of a Disclosing Party's information in any manner which would violate United States laws, regulations, or requirements restricting the export, re-export, transfer or release to certain entities or destinations, including to persons within the Receiving Party or its Affiliates, or to unrelated Third Parties.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the export control clause and significantly weakening it by removing the reference to US law and regulations and negating any responsibility for compliance and any repercussions for violating these laws. This is a high-risk change, as it directly contradicts legal requirements for export compliance.
